org.eng.aisp.util

Class MatrixUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.util.MatrixUtil

  • public class MatrixUtil
extends Object
    Utilities operating on matrices of double values in which the first index (i.e. double[i]) iterates over columns in the matrix.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Method Detail

      • columnDifference

        public static double[][] columnDifference(double[][] matrix)
        Compute a new matrix that is the difference of the columns. Column i in the new matrix is the difference between column i+1 and column i in the given matrix. THe returned matrix has one less column than the input.
        Parameters:
        matrix - a 2D matrix in which the columns are indexed by the 1st index and the rows by the 2nd index.
        Returns:
        never null. A matrix that has one less column than the input.

      • columnDelta

        public static double[][] columnDelta(double[][] matrix,
                                     int windowHalfWidth)
        Compute a new matrix that is the delta of the columns. The delta is defined as the standard way for speech processing as in http://practicalcryptography.com/miscellaneous/machine-learning/guide-mel-frequency-cepstral-coefficients-mfccs/#deltas-and-delta-deltas. The returned matrix has the same number of columns as the input.
        Parameters:
        matrix - a 2D matrix in which the columns are indexed by the 1st index and the rows by the 2nd index.
        Returns:
        never null. A new matrix with the same dimensions as the input.
        Throws:
        AISPException

      • averageRows

        public static double[] averageRows(double[][] matrix)
        Get a single column of values that is average across corresponding rows of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - a 2D matrix in which the columns are indexed by the 1st index and the rows by the 2nd index.
        Returns:
        never null. A vector of row averages.

      • averageColumns

        public static double[] averageColumns(double[][] matrix)
        Get a single row of values that is average across corresponding columns of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - a 2D matrix in which the columns are indexed by the 1st index and the rows by the 2nd index.
        Returns:
        never null. A vector of column averages.

        Returns:

        Returns:

        multiplier -
        inplace - if true, then modify the input, otherwise create a new array to hold the new values.

      • linearTransform

        public static double[][] linearTransform(double[][] matrix,
                                         double offset,
                                         double slope,
                                         boolean inPlace)
        Apply a linear transformation to the value in the matrix. The transformation is defined as 
           y = slope * x + offset;
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        offset -
        slope -
        inPlace -
        Returns:
        a transformed matrix, newly allocated if inPlace is true.

      • zeroMean

        public static double[][] zeroMean(double[][] matrix,
                                  boolean inPlace)
        Return a the values in the given matrix adjust to have a zero average value.
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        inPlace - true if the input matrix is modified, otherwise create a new matrix.
        Returns:
        never null.

        Returns an array containing only the diagonal elements of a matrix
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        1D array containing the diagonal elements of fullMatrix

      • normalize

        public static double[][] normalize(double[][] matrix,
                                   boolean normalizeStddev,
                                   boolean zeroMean,
                                   MatrixUtil.NormalizationMode mode,
                                   boolean inPlace)
        Scale/shift values in the matrix. Columns are indexed by first index, rows by second index.
        Parameters:
        m - data to base return values on
        normalizeStddev - if true, then normalize the inputs relative to the standard deviation. If false, then normalize to the range of values.
        zeroMean - if true, then also remove the mean from the input.
        mode - controls whether normalization is done across the whole matrix, across individual rows or individual columns.
        inPlace - if true, then modify the input matrix, otherwise create a new one.
        Returns:
        a matrix of the same size as the input and allocated according to inPlace.

      • getStats

        public static OnlineStats getStats(double[][] matrix)
        Get the statistics across all cells in the matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix -

      • showMatrix

        public static void showMatrix(double[][] matrix)

        public static void main(String[] args)

      • selectColumns

        public static double[][] selectColumns(double[][] matrix,
                                       int startColumn,
                                       int lastColumnExclusive,
                                       boolean refColumns)
        Create a new matrix from a range of columns from the given matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        startColumn - the first column, 0-indexed, to include in the output
        lastColumnExclusive - 0-based index of last column to include, exclusive.
        refColumns - if false, then make copies of the source column, otherwise just reference the columns from the given matrix.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • appendColumns

        public static double[][] appendColumns(double[][] base,
                                       double[][] toAppend)
        Append the columns of the two matrices to create a new matrix. The columnar data in the output is shared with the data in the input - that is columns are not copied in the new matrix.
        Parameters:
        base -
        toAppend -
        Returns:
        a matrix that has the base matrix as the left-most (starting at 0 index) columns and the toAppend matrix as the right-most columsn (ends with the last index of the returned matrix).

      • autoCorrelateColumns

        public static double[][] autoCorrelateColumns(double[][] matrix,
                                              int lags)
        Compute the full auto-correlation with each column.
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        lags - the number of lags to compute in the correlations, including 0. Must be greater or equal to 0 and less then the size of a column.
        Returns:
        a matrix in which each column is the auto-correlation of the source column. The matrix has the same number of columns as the input and the size of each column is equal to the number of lags.

      • matchRange

        public static double[][] matchRange(double[][] matrix,
                                    double[][] range,
                                    boolean inPlace)
        Linearly map the range (min, max) of the given matrix to range of the range-defining matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to rerange.
        range - defines range of values to which the given matrix is mapped.
        inPlace - if true, then the input array is modified in place, otherwise a new array is created to contain the transformed values.
        Returns:

      • matchRange

        public static double[][] matchRange(double[][] matrix,
                                    double newMin,
                                    double newMax,
                                    boolean inPlace)
        Linearly map the range (min, max) of the given matrix to range of the range-defining matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        newMin - the desired minimum of the returned matrix.
        newMax - the desired maximum of the returned matrix.
        inPlace - if true, then the input array is modified in place, otherwise a new array is created to contain the transformed values.
        Returns:
        a matrix of the same dimensions as the input, linearly mapped to the given range.
